title.narrative: IR 102 MALNUTRITION CHRONIQUE

description.narrative: At least 75% of children diagnosed with severe acute malnutrition recover following adequate treatment. At least 50% of children under-2 years benefit from interventions to prevent or reduce stunting and at least 50% of mothers reached with behaviour change interventions to improve the rate of exclusive breast feeding in target regions by the end of 2014., which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2014, contribute to reduce the prevalence of chronic malnutrition among children less than five years from 50.1% to 45% and under five mortality rate by 30%.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
